value: <l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">too powerful, in play after play: it creates improvisation;</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">crowd; confusion; a sense of waste; here</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">profane; here bareness. <del>The</del> The</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">character is <del>volubly explored; & in the</del> wings</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>propituous</del> bound to the wheel of the plot.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">And <del>apparently the lack of curtains makes</del> the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">anonymous player is [irreparable?] in the wrong [same?].</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">He bolts his words out; has no [existence?];</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">deforms.   We are left in the end with out</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">   <del>But</del> an end. <del>And</del> so much of the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">emotion is wasted.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>All this of course leads up to the</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>It is thus, in [ready?] [illeg.] through a handful of the</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>early plays, that</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>Exactly what problems had to</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">If, however, we scramble the plays together,</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>taking them <del>as a</del> not so much as separate</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>creations, but as a</del> we can unite them</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">not separately, but as a <del>great</del> complete</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">experiment: as the common effort to</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>sede</del> explore in their immense [reserves?] of</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>relieves its [pressure?]</del> at last, until 
            <choice>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>Only</del> <del>It</del> <del>Its silence</del> The [workshop? woodshop] is</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">without laws. There is no comment.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">We are left thus to read fitfully; [unsatisfied?]:</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">without direction. Unless indeed we see the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">bodily cauldron of their plays; & conceive</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">that the nameless, uncommonly [illeg.], were</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">somehow all compressing to [thread?]</l>
